com.github.bjarneh.utilz

Class message

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bjarneh.utilz.message

  • public class message
extends Object
    Wrapper functions for Java's MessageDigest library. 
    
 // Typical use:

 byte[] bytes = message.md5("filename.txt");
 System.out.printf("md5sum('filename.txt'): %s\n", message.toHex(bytes));
    note: There is a lot of comments here since this is meant to be a library with some documentation, i.e. make sure you turn on your comment folding before you start reading this file.

    • Method Detail

      • digest

        public static byte[] digest(byte[] b,
            String algorithm)
                     throws IOException,
                            NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Compute a security hash of an array of bytes. This function is basically just a wrapper for the standard library MessageDigest methods.
        Parameters:
        b - bytes to base the hash on
        algorithm - which message digest algorithm to use
        Throws:
        IOException
        NoSuchAlgorithmException

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • digest

        public static byte[] digest(InputStream stream,
            String algorithm)
                     throws IOException,
                            NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Wrapper for the Java message digest library.
        Parameters:
        stream - of bytes we base our message digest on
        algorithm - to use when creating the digest sum/hash
        Returns:
        message digest for byte in input stream using algorithm
        Throws:
        IOException
        NoSuchAlgorithmException
